channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 这个神圣的月份是否平静，部分取决于三个问题 AP
item.description:
Whether this holy month is calm or not depends in part on three questions https://t.co/Z62EtexBIm

Image: AP pic.twitter.com/g9ommNcwp7

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 中国的年度议会会议是习近平绝对权力的展示。今年的会议显示，领导人的决策与国家的迫切需求之间的脱节日益严重👇。
item.description:
China’s annual meeting of parliament is a display of the absolute power of Xi Jinping. This year it has revealed a growing disconnect between the leader’s policy­making and the country’s urgent needs https://t.co/yGFgtpAcUI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: "奥本海默》是自 2011 年以来第一部获得奥斯卡最佳影片的大片。请阅读它是如何受到奥斯卡和公众的喜爱 👇 的。
item.description:
“Oppenheimer” is the first blockbuster since 2011 to win Best Picture at the Oscars. Read how it proved to be as beloved by the Academy as by the public https://t.co/SYEYx31ZhM 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 风险是金融市场的核心。但是，要精确地确定风险是什么，更不用说你想要多少风险以及应该遵循哪些投资选择，这可能会让人抓狂。我们将解释投资者是如何搞错的 👇
item.description:
Risk sits at the heart of financial markets. But trying to pin down precisely what it is, let alone how much of it you want and which investment choices should follow, can be maddening.

We explain how investors get it wrong https://t.co/e1cCRqndyo 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 准妈妈很快就能在显微镜下看到属于她感觉到在体内踢动的婴儿的肺部复制品： 👇
item.description:
A prospective mother could soon look down a microscope and see a replica lung belonging to the baby she feels kicking inside.

Learn how: https://t.co/3YeFKjRpXc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 在小说中，病理学家面对一具尸体，能够咬一口三明治，立即宣布死亡时间。现在，人工智能正在提供帮助 👇
item.description:
In fiction, hard-pressed pathologists presented with a corpse are able to take a bite of their sandwich and instantly pronounce a time of death. Reality is a lot messier.

Now artificial intelligence is offering a helping hand https://t.co/KVyyOnx46W 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 提高欧洲的军事机动性对于威慑俄罗斯至关重要。但它已被各国的法规和海关要求所纠缠，而所需的有形基础设施却被忽视👇。
item.description:
Improving military mobility in Europe is crucial for deterring Russia. But it has become entangled in a web of national regulations and customs requirements, while the physical infrastructure needed has been neglected https://t.co/ArxTdYMfAr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 在 6 月的欧洲大选中，强硬右翼有望赢得四分之一的席位，而现在仅为五分之一。但要对现状发起挑战，他们需要结成一个协调一致的联盟👇。
item.description:
At European elections in June, the hard right are on track to win a quarter of all seats, up from a fifth now. But to mount a challenge to status quo they would need to form a coherent and united alliance https://t.co/fxsk5du35m 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 当如此多的人被杀害时，乌克兰野生动物的命运却很少受到关注，这并不奇怪。战争对海豚的影响尤其可怕 👇。
item.description:
Not surprisingly, when so many humans are being killed, the fate of Ukraine’s wildlife has gained scant attention. The war’s effect on dolphins has been especially awful https://t.co/bqlhJCKq3z 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 有三个潜在的爆发点：耶路撒冷的阿克萨清真寺、加沙的人道主义危机以及以色列是否将其行动扩大到拉法👇。
item.description:
There are three potential flash points: the al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem, the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and whether Israel extends its campaign to Rafah https://t.co/jwxfFDrvgh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 加布里埃尔-加西亚-马尔克斯（Gabriel García Márquez）的声音无疑可以在《直到八月》这部遗作中听到。但他并不希望出版这部作品，这引发了有关作者同意和文学来世的问题 👇。
item.description:
Gabriel García Márquez’s voice can certainly be heard in “Until August”, a posthumous novella. But he did not want it to be published, raising questions about authors’ consent and the literary afterlife https://t.co/Zn9j2ilCWn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 自 1974 年以来，葡萄牙一直是民主过渡和稳定的典范。现在，葡萄牙正面临着一段政治动荡期，此前的选举没有给任何政党留下一条明确的执政道路。
item.description:
Portugal has mostly been a model of democratic transition and stability since 1974. Now it is facing a period of political turmoil, after an election has left no party a clear path to govern https://t.co/KpXayy24R2

Image: Reuters pic.twitter.com/jxDBcV5byX

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: WPL 是去年在印度推出的一项赛事，它正在改变女子板球运动。本土球星受益最大 🏏
item.description:
The WPL, a tournament based in India, launched last year—and it is transforming women’s cricket. Home-grown stars stand to benefit the most https://t.co/DuumPSHMqS 🏏

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: "现代人工智能的 "教父 "之一约书亚-本吉奥（Yoshua Bengio）在本周的 "巴贝奇 "播客🎧中讨论了人工智能是如何创建的。
item.description:
“We didn’t try to model the human brain in silicon because that would have seemed too daunting a task.”

Yoshua Bengio, one of the “godfathers” of modern AI, discusses how it was created on this week’s “Babbage” podcast https://t.co/IN2O8abx4C 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "智力 "节目将探讨肥胖问题，全球肥胖率正在稳步上升。能否阻止或至少减缓这一问题？
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”, a look at obesity levels, which are steadily rising across the globe. Can the problem be stopped, or at least, slowed? https://t.co/qY4CxDuf5d pic.twitter.com/9KWLLAHS72

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 英国最有名的小报正在软化。那些担心文化右翼前进的人可以从中吸取两个教训👇。
item.description:
Britain’s most famous tabloid newspaper is softening. Those who fret about the advance of the cultural right can take two lessons from this https://t.co/UxXVXu1L4v 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 沃达丰的价值曾一度超过苹果。发生了什么？这家英国电信公司正试图通过瘦身恢复健康 👇
item.description:
Vodafone was once worth more than Apple. What happened? The British telecoms company is trying to slim its way back to health https://t.co/euLrF2LaKG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 常春藤联盟的霸主地位正因领导不力而受到损害。如果美国的名牌大学希望在今后的几个世纪里继续保持其卓越地位，那么它们现在就必须改弦更张。信誉往往会慢慢降低，然后一下子全部降低👇。
item.description:
The Ivy League’s supremacy is being undermined by bad leadership.

If America’s great universities wish to remain pre-eminent for centuries more, they must correct course now. Credibility often diminishes slowly—and then all at once https://t.co/oNeNkUCrCa 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 遏制货币投机的努力分散了人们对更大改革的注意力，而这些改革是使尼日利亚成为一个有吸引力的经商之地所必需的。只有当尼日利亚卖出更多商品或赢得外国投资者的信任时，才能解决美元长期短缺的问题。
item.description:
Efforts to curb currency speculation distract from the bigger reforms needed to make Nigeria an attractive place to do business. Only when the country sells more, or wins the confidence of foreign investors, will it solve its chronic shortage of dollars https://t.co/SMhLiXKcww

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 朝鲜世袭独裁者金正恩正在对韩国展开新一轮侵略。他最近的言论有几种趋势令人担忧👇。
item.description:
Kim Jong Un, North Korea’s hereditary dictator, is embarking on a new round of aggression towards South Korea.

Several trends make his recent rhetoric worrying https://t.co/Nb6IQfAALx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 自 1974 年以来，葡萄牙一直是民主过渡和稳定的典范。现在，葡萄牙正面临着一段政治动荡期，因为在一次选举之后，没有一个政党有明确的执政道路👇。
item.description:
Portugal has mostly been a model of democratic transition and stability since 1974. Now it is facing a period of political turmoil, after an election has left no party a clear path to govern https://t.co/FVdExXrHJB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 很多普通中国人担心，国家这艘巨轮正在漂泊，没有舵。但是，如果不承认这一点，似乎就会怀疑习近平这位伟大的舵手。在 2024 年，这是不允许的。
item.description:
Lots of ordinary Chinese citizens worry that the ship of state is drifting, rudderless. But this cannot be admitted without seeming to doubt Xi Jinping, the great helmsman. In 2024, that is simply not allowed https://t.co/jQInCGgjlL 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 本周的 "制衡 "节目： 🎧我们的记者考察了参选的第三方候选人🎧我们回到了第三方成为焦点的另一个时代🎧@daniella_raz解释了人们对第三方的误解之处
item.description:
This week on “Checks and Balance”: https://t.co/j4ctANFKbO

🎧 Our correspondent examines the third-party candidates in the running
🎧 We go back to another time when third parties were in the spotlight
🎧 @daniella_raz explains what people get wrong about them

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 阿司匹林制造商面临长期危机 👇
item.description:
The maker of Aspirin faces a chronic crisis https://t.co/URlcAfZawi 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 金正恩一直在讨好弗拉基米尔-普京，这加剧了人们对这位隐士王国领导人可能正在考虑战争的担忧。在 "情报 "节目中，@AndrewMIKnox 解释了一些人担心的原因。收听播客： 🎧
item.description:
Kim Jong Un has been cosying up to Vladimir Putin, increasing fears that the leader of the hermit kingdom may be considering war. On “The Intelligence”, @AndrewMIKnox explains why some are worried. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/XJDmw4vWYV 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: ♦️ 乔-拜登将宣布他的预算提案。♦️ 一位共和党参议员因其对工会状况的反驳而遭到抨击。♦️ 总统和唐纳德-特朗普在佐治亚州举行了对决式竞选活动。请关注美国政治的最新动态：
item.description:
♦️ Joe Biden will announce his proposed budget.

♦️ A Republican senator is under fire for her state-of-the-union rebuttal.

♦️ The president and Donald Trump held duelling campaign events in Georgia.

Follow the latest in American politics: https://t.co/MBBGGBrTLp pic.twitter.com/5HvWeYoRbL

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 对英国和美国股票价格的研究让现代投资组合理论的拥护者感到失望。在中低波动率股票中，收益是集中的，波动几乎没有任何影响。在风险较高的股票中，情况更糟
item.description:
An examination of British and American share prices is disappointing for adherents of Modern Portfolio Theory.

Among medium and low volatilities, returns are clustered, with volatility having barely any effect. Among riskier stocks, things are even worse https://t.co/RptzAcVya5

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 但是，我们有充分的理由相信，未来将出现更多的供应、更低的价格，以及最重要的是更多的竞争👇。
item.description:
The limited volumes and high cost of weight-loss drugs mean they are unobtainable for many who could benefit from them.

But there are good reasons to think that the future will see expanded supply, low prices, and—most importantly—more competition https://t.co/6famsPullJ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 在大多數博物館中，真正展出的藏品數量極少。陈旧的储藏室已令人疲惫不堪，但搬家可以为我们提供重新发现、重新评估和重新整理物品的机会。
item.description:
At most museums, a tiny fraction of objects is actually on view. Old storerooms are tired—but moving house can aﬀord the chance to rediscover, reassess and reorganise possessions https://t.co/BaBtv68AVl 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024

item.title: 过去十年间，中国运行的卫星数量大幅增加，总数已超过 600 颗。这是否值得担忧？有了人工智能的帮助，美国可能会担心👇。
item.description:
Over the past decade China has massively increased the number of satellites it has in operation, to a total of over 600.

Is this a cause for concern? With AI helping out, it could be for America https://t.co/88X6CyUWCI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 11, 2024
